isis.stitle: TSI 97-12-14R1 - Replaced Identification Marking for the Inner and Outer Gerotor Gears

subjectgroup.subject: Replaced Identification Marking for the Inner and Outer Gerotor Gears

important.para: THIS LETTER REPLACES TSI 96-12-17 DATED AUGUST, 1996 AND TSI 97-12-14 DATED MAY, 1997. DISCARD TSI 96-12-17 AND TSI 97-12-14 AND REPLACE WITH TSI 97-12 14R1.

geninfo.para:
The inked stamping 'OUT' found on the inner and outer gerotor gears was replaced with a stamped 'DAMPER', found on both the inner and outer gerotor gears (refer to Inner And Outer Gerotors Identification Marks
).

svcproc.stitle: TSI 97-12-14R1 - Replaced Identification Marking for the Inner and Outer Gerotor Gears
svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: The permanently stamped marks will allow proper assembly in the field. Proper assembly orientation is important to avoid scuffing and potential scoring.
The REMOVAL procedure remains the same as found in Service Manual EGES 120.
The ASSEMBLY procedure found in Service Manual EGES 120 has changed as follows:

note.para: The inner and outer gerotor gears are serviced as a matched set. DO NOT mix gears.

important.para:
THE ORIENTATION OF THE INNER TO OUTER GEROTORS IS VERY IMPORTANT. BE SURE THE STAMPED WORD 'DAMPER', FOUND ON THE INNER AND OUTER GEARS IS FACING THE OIL PUMP HOUSING, NOT THE CRANKCASE (REFER TO INNER AND OUTER GEROTORS IDENTIFICATION MARKS
).

step1.para: Lubricate the inner gerotor gear with clean engine oil and install over the crankshaft nose.
Lubricate the outer gerotor gear with clean engine oil and install into the oil pump housing.
Install the oil pump housing square cut seal ring into the oil pump housing.
Align dowel pins and install oil pump housing with seal ring and large gerotor gear onto crankshaft. install four (4) retaining bolts and tighten.

note.para: Keep a copy of the service bulletin with Service Manual EGES 120, until an updated version is available.
